column4: can anyone help me? dapper doesn't want to get past the hardware screen on my system! ANY help is appreciated greatly. I can also provide detailed system specs to help you help me :).
what part specifically does it hang on?
it hangs on the scanning hardware part. there is a blue screen that is frozen.
i chose not to try amd64... i am install an i386 dapper on a amd 3700
yes.
I don't quite know what to tell you...  Have you tried other linux distributions on this machine?
and bobstro , I have. Debian, knoppix, ubuntu breezy.
are they using the 2.6.15 kernel?
i only use breezy and it's latest everything.
This is when you're trying to boot the livecd, right?
this is when im trying to install the system
i used this: http://mirror.cs.umn.edu/ubuntu-releases/6.06/ubuntu-6.06-alternate-i386.iso.torrent
no. that's redundant! Utorrent does that for me
You could hypothetically upgrade through distupgrade, but I wonder if your rebooting problems wouldn't persist
should i try to get the desktop ubuntu instead of the alternate?
I wouldn't know...  I don't even know the difference  :x  But I doubt that the startup would be different, just the included packages
my breezy is a little fucked up. i want to reinstall.
I know the feeling
when I boot my desktop ISO, I have an option to start in safe graphics mode
i should get desktop.  alternate sucks, obviously
If you use memtest as the kernel, it'll perform a memory test
my memory is fine. i just installed breezy! i've tested it before
i'll try that when i get my new iso in 13 minutes
